Nearest Airport: Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport, Leh — approx 7 km The India Travel Community+2Leh Ladakh India+2

Name: Leh Palace, Leh (Ladakh)
Nearest Railway Station: Nearest railway is far, likely Jammu Tawi or Srinagar (~ several hundred km). Not documented precise.
Nearest Bus Stand: Leh Bus Stand — within Leh town (< 5 km) — exact distance depends on starting point. Not documented exact.
Nearest Airport: Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport, Leh — approx 5 km from Leh town center Wikipedia+1
Entry Fee: For Indian nationals approx ₹15-25; for foreign nationals approx ₹100 WanderOn
Best Time to Visit: June to September (summer season for accessibility & pleasant weather); also shoulder months like May / October when possible Beyond Wild Places+1
Accessibility: Located on a hill (Namgyal hill) overlooking Leh; uphill roads or walk from town; steep paths inside. Not fully wheelchair-friendly. Snow in winter may block access.
Guided Tours: Local guides / heritage walk operators include Leh Palace; audio guide sometimes available; not always official. Not documented full details.
Parking: Some parking near base; small local parking lots; Not documented charges.
Nearby Amenities: In Leh town: hotels, cafés, shops, markets. Within walking/driving distance of Leh Bazaar, restaurants.
Special Notes: Built in 17th century by Singey Namgyal; nine-storey grand structure; used for royal family residence; now partly ruined; offers panoramic views; close to other attractions like Shanti Stupa, Namgyal Tsemo, etc.

Name: Shey Palace & Monastery, Shey (Leh District, Ladakh)
Nearest Bus Stand: Leh Bus Stand; local transport from Leh to Shey (~15 km) Wikipedia+1
Nearest Airport: Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport, Leh — approx distance depends via road to Shey (~15-20 km from Leh + from airport to Leh). Not documented exact.
Timings: Shey Monastery is open to visitors; inner sanctum sometimes closed; Not documented specific daily hours. Wikipedia
Entry Fee: Not documented in reliable sources for general access; special access permissions required for some inner parts. Wikipedia
Best Time to Visit: May-October — when roads are open, weather pleasant; winters very harsh. Beyond Wild Places+1
Accessibility: Road access from Leh via highway; slight uphill hillock; some walking required; not fully wheelchair-friendly. Snow may block in winter.
Guided Tours: Yes — part of common circuits of monasteries around Leh; local guides available.
Parking: Basic parking near monastery/palace grounds; Not documented fees.
Nearby Amenities: Shey village has small shops, local eateries; accommodations limited compared to Leh; restrooms at monastery.
Special Notes: Shey was summer capital historically; contains large copper-gilded gold statue of Buddha; many chorten fields around; offers good views over Indus valley; significant in Ladakhi culture and history.
